sentences.en: He felt himself from disuse to be unfit for parochial duty.
sentences.cn: 他觉得自己由于长期不工作,已经不适合做教区的职务了.

sentences.en: He gazed with admiration on the war chariots and glittering arms now reposing in disuse.
sentences.cn: 他带着羡慕的目光凝视着被弃置不用的战车,和闪闪发光的武器.

sentences.en: Its deplorable peculiarity was, that it was the faintness of solitude and disuse.
sentences.cn: 却是由于孤独与废弃所导致的衰弱, 而这正是它凄惨的特色.

sentences.en: She had only rudimentary cosmetics, dry and cracking with disuse.
sentences.cn: 她只有一些起码的, 因为久已不用而干裂的化妆品.

sentences.en: That law on the right of inheritance has fallen into disuse.
sentences.cn: 那项继承权法已经废止了.

sentences.en: That method fell [ came ] into disuse.
The building eventually fell into disuse .
sentences.cn: 该建筑物最终被废弃不用了。

sentences.en: The factory fell into disuse twenty years ago.
sentences.cn: 这个工厂二十年前就废弃了。

sentences.en: The machine has become rusty from disuse.
sentences.cn: 机器已经因不用而生锈.

sentences.en: The room smelt of disuse and mouldering books.
sentences.cn: 房间里有一股长期不用和霉烂书籍的味道。

sentences.en: The tramway fell into disuse in the 1920 s.
sentences.cn: 有轨电车于20世纪20年代不用了.

sentences.en: The wheel had long since rusted from years of disuse.
sentences.cn: 多年不用的车轮早已锈迹斑斑。

sentences.en: The word has passed into complete disuse.
sentences.cn: 这个词已经完全不用了.

sentences.en: These methods have fallen into disuse.
sentences.cn: 这些方法已废而不用了.

sentences.en: This irrigation canal has fallen into disuse.

trans.tran_en: a situation in which something is no longer used
a situation in which something is no longer used
